text: Table 3: The frequency of in-hospital mortality, right-ventricular failure and the 1- and 5-year actuarial survival and survival on condition of hospital discharge

Figure 1: Kaplan-Meier survival plots of the overall actuarial survival according to the weight mismatch tertile group, from the time of operation to final follow-up. There was reduced survival among those in the lowest tertile group, log-rank p=0.04.

Figure 2: Kaplan-Meier survival plots of the midterm survival according to the weight mismatch tertile group, on the condition of discharge from hospital. The plots were not significantly different, log-rank p=0.136.
Fig. 3) (p=-0.12, p=0.14). Even when excluding the 11 patients who had been inestibuted for more than 100 , there was no association (p=-0.10, p=0.38) (Fig. 4).
Fig. 5). Again, if the six patients who were in the ITU for more than 2000 were excluded, there was still no association (p<0.01, p=0.98).
